user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_mkfs:
```c
int32 OS_mkfs(char *address, const char *devname, const char *volname, size_t blocksize, osal_blockcount_t numblocks)
{
    int32 return_code;

    return_code = OS_FileSys_Initialize(address, devname, volname, blocksize, numblocks, true);

    if (return_code == OS_ERR_INCORRECT_OBJ_STATE || return_code == OS_ERR_NO_FREE_IDS)
    {
        /*
         * This is the historic filesystem-specific error code generated when
         * attempting to mkfs()/initfs() on a filesystem that was
         * already initialized, or if there were no free slots in the table.
         *
         * This code preserved just in case application code was checking for it.
         */
        return_code = OS_FS_ERR_DEVICE_NOT_FREE;
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags: return_code = OS_FileSys_Initialize(address, devname, volname, blocksize, numblocks, true);
explanation: The remaining fragments (function signature and local variable declaration) are simple declarations and do not themselves create unreachable code. The suspicious fragments selected cover: the call to OS_FileSys_Initialize (which could be non-returning or provably never produce certain values), the conditional that maps legacy error codes (which could be statically impossible or redundant), the assignment inside that conditional, and the final return (which would be unreachable if the initializer never returns). These are the points that need investigation to determine whether any part of the function is provably unreachable. No other executable statements exist in the function, so no additional fragments require investigation.
